channel.title: Le Nhan Pham
channel.description: Recent content on Le Nhan Pham

item.title: Publication
item.description: Publications Pham, L. N.; Walsh, T. Predicting Biomolecule Adsorption on MoS2 Nanosheets with High Structural Fidelity. Chem. Sci. 2022 doi:10.1039/D1SC06814H (Chem Sci Pick of the Week). Pham, L. N.; Walsh, T. R. Force Fields for Water–Surface Interaction: Is Reproduction of the Experimental Water Contact Angle Enough? Chem. Commun. 2021, 57 (27), 3355–3358. doi:10.1039/d1cc00426c. Pham, L. N.; Russo, S. P. Energetic Degeneracy and Electronic Structures of Germanium Trimers Doped with Titanium.

item.title: Research
item.description: I. Research of interests 2D nanomaterials and biological materials Molecular dynamics force field development Semiconductor clusters doped with transition metals Transition metal oxide magnetic materials II. Force Field development Here we introduce data used for development of MoSu-CHARMM and notices for usage of MoSu-CHARMM Data used for fitting MoSu-CHARMM force field This depository contains all crystal structure files (CIF) of several optimized adsorption configurations used to calculate fitting and validation datasets of energy which were employed to fit and validate the MoSu-CHARMM.

item.title: Recent news
item.description:
I'm thrilled to announce that my @ChemicalScience paper coauthored by Prof. Tiffany Walsh at @DeakinIfm has been selected as Chem Sci Pick of the Week. It will be published in a special collection soon. Stay tuned!
üçª pic.twitter.com/Jqg4xZ0FWT

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanPham1) March 18, 2022

Very excited to share my recently accepted manuscript in @ChemicalScience. A new high-fidelity force field for MD description of interaction between 2D MoS2 and organic materials including peptides and proteins.https://t.co/sR8Lqzcxhi

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanPham1) March 16, 2022

Our recently accepted paper in @ChemCommun proposes a novel criterion and then a new protocol for assessment and development of interfacial force fields. Very excited to share it here.

https://t.co/9OD4VZeXQO

— Le Nhan (@LeNhanPham1) March 1, 2021

item.title: About
item.description:
LE NHAN PHAM

I am a chemist whose research experience is related to physical & theoretical chemistry and materials, particularly atomic clusters, excited states, and currently 2D&biological materials. I graduated (Ph.D.) from Department of Chemistry, University of Leuven, Belgium (September 2019), and is currently working as a postdoctoral research fellow at Deakin University and visiting scholar at Department of Physics, RMIT, Australia. I was also a yearly-contract lecturer at Department of Chemistry, University of Dalat, Vietnam.
